name: Myeongjin Jeonbok
address: 512 Haemajihaean-ro, Gujwa-eup, Jeju-si, Jeju-do, South Korea
history: Myeongjin Jeonbok is renowned for its abalone dishes, particularly the abalone porridge. The restaurant is popular among both locals and tourists for its fresh seafood and traditional Korean ambiance.

name: Donsadon
address: 11 Woljeong 1-gil, Aewol-eup, Jeju-si, Jeju-do, South Korea
history: Donsadon is a popular restaurant known for serving some of the best Jeju Black Pork (Heukdwaeji). The meat is grilled at the table, providing an authentic and delicious Korean BBQ experience.

name: Olle Market
history: Olle Market is a traditional market in Seogwipo where you can find a variety of local delicacies such as black pork, seafood, and freshly squeezed tangerine juice. It is a must-visit for food lovers.

name: Sangchunjae
address: 14-2 Beonyeong-ro, Aewol-eup, Jeju-si, Jeju-do, South Korea
history: Sangchunjae is a traditional Korean restaurant that specializes in serving high-quality, authentic Jeju cuisine. It’s known for its fresh seafood dishes and stunning views of the ocean.

name: Nangpoon Babsang
address: 28, Yeondong 6-gil, Jeju-si, Jeju-do, Republic of Korea
history: Taste of local food of Jeju

name: Hwaro Hyang
history: Hwaro Hyang is a popular BBQ restaurant known for its Jeju black pork and other premium meats. The restaurant provides a cozy atmosphere and excellent service, making it a favorite among meat lovers.

name: INNISFREE JEJU HOUSE DESSERT CAFE
address: 23 Shinhwayeoksa-ro, Andeok-myeon, Seogwipo-si, Jeju-do (next to the Osulloc Tea Museum)
history: Hareubang Coffee is a cozy cafe located near the coast, offering stunning ocean views and a relaxed atmosphere. The cafe is known for its specialty coffee and homemade desserts.

name: Black Pork Street
history: Black Pork Street is a famous street in Jeju City known for its numerous restaurants specializing in Jeju Black Pork. The street is a popular destination for locals and tourists alike, offering some of the best grilled pork in the region.

name: Jeju Dongmun Traditional Market
history: Jeju Dongmun Traditional Market is one of the oldest and most famous markets in Jeju. It offers a wide variety of local produce, seafood, and street food. The market is a vibrant hub of activity and a great place to experience local Jeju culture.

name: Bagdad Cafe
history: Bagdad Cafe is an Indian restaurant located in Jeju City, known for its flavorful curries and warm atmosphere. The restaurant offers a mix of traditional Indian dishes and fusion cuisine, making it a popular spot for both locals and tourists.

name: Happy Noodle House
history: A popular spot for haejangguk (hangover soup), known for its rich broth and hearty ingredients.

name: Terarosa
history: Terarosa’s Seogwipo branch known for its coffee and bread. Located near Soesokkak Estuary. Sells coffee gadgets and accessories.

name: Heukdonga
address: 11 Halladaehak-ro, Nohyeong-dong, Jeju-si, Jeju-do, South Korea
history: Jeju Heukdonga specializes in Jeju black pork, offering premium cuts and a traditional grilling experience.

name: Samdajeong
address: 1st Floor, 80 Noyeon-ro, Yeondong, Jeju-si, Jeju-do, South Korea
history: A cozy restaurant known for its traditional Korean set meals and side dishes, popular among locals.
